Both Nb(1)-Se(2) bond lengths are 2.66 Å. There are two shorter (2.61 Å) and two longer (2.63 Å) Nb(1)-Cl(1,2) bond lengths. There are two inequivalent Se sites. In the first Se site, Se(1) is bonded in a 2-coordinate geometry to two equivalent Nb(1) atoms. In the second Se site, Se(2) is bonded in a 2-coordinate geometry to two equivalent Nb(1) atoms. Cl(1,2) is bonded in a water-like geometry to two equivalent Nb(1) atoms.

The H(1)-O(1) bond length is 0.97 Å. O(1) is bonded in a distorted single-bond geometry to three equivalent Mn(1) and one H(1) atom.

K4HgAs2 crystallizes in the trigonal P-3m1 space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one K4HgAs2 sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are two inequivalent K sites. All K(2)-As(1) bond lengths are 3.42 Å. Hg(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to six equivalent K(2) and two equivalent As(1) atoms. Both Hg(1)-As(1) bond lengths are 2.54 Å. As(1) is bonded in a 7-coordinate geometry to three equivalent K(1), three equivalent K(2), and one Hg(1) atom.

HgI2 is Indium-like structured and crystallizes in the monoclinic C2/m space group. The structure is zero-dimensional and consists of two mercuric iodide molecules. Hg(1) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent I(1) atoms. Both Hg(1)-I(1) bond lengths are 2.69 Å. I(1) is bonded in a single-bond geometry to one Hg(1) atom.

Lix0CoO2 is trigonal omega-like structured and crystallizes in the triclinic P-1 space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one Lix0CoO2 sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. O(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent Co(1) atoms.

P4S3 is Indium-like structured and crystallizes in the orthorhombic Pmc2_1 space group. The structure is zero-dimensional and consists of two phosphorus sesquisulfide molecules. In the second S site, S(2) is bonded in a water-like geometry to one P(2) and one P(3) atom.

Sb crystallizes in the hexagonal P6/mmm space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one Sb sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Sb(1) is bonded in a hexagonal planar geometry to six equivalent Sb(1) atoms. All Sb(1)-Sb(1) bond lengths are 3.15 Å.

SrThBr6 crystallizes in the orthorhombic Pmm2 space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one SrThBr6 sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Both Sr(1)-Br(4) bond lengths are 2.95 Å. All Sr(1)-Br(2) bond lengths are 3.22 Å. Th(1) is bonded in a 8-coordinate geometry to two equivalent Br(1), two equivalent Br(2), and four equivalent Br(3) atoms. Both Th(1)-Br(1) bond lengths are 2.93 Å. In the first Br site, Br(1) is bonded in an L-shaped geometry to two equivalent Th(1) atoms. YI3 is Bismuth triodide-like structured and crystallizes in the trigonal P-31m space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one YI3 sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Y(1) is bonded to six equivalent I(1) atoms to form edge-sharing YI6 octahedra. All Y(1)-I(1) bond lengths are 3.03 Å. I(1) is bonded in an L-shaped geometry to two equivalent Y(1) atoms.

Nb2S2C crystallizes in the trigonal P-3m1 space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one Nb2S2C sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Nb(1) is bonded to three equivalent C(1) and three equivalent S(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NbC3S3 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Nb(1)-C(1) bond lengths are 2.25 Å. All Nb(1)-S(1) bond lengths are 2.52 Å. C(1) is bonded to six equivalent Nb(1) atoms to form edge-sharing CNb6 octahedra. S(1) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent Nb(1) atoms.

CrOCl crystallizes in the orthorhombic Pmmn space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one CrOCl sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Cr(1) is bonded to four equivalent O(1) and two equivalent Cl(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing CrCl2O4 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 26°. There are two shorter (1.98 Å) and two longer (2.04 Å) Cr(1)-O(1) bond lengths. Both Cr(1)-Cl(1) bond lengths are 2.33 Å. O(1) is bonded to four equivalent Cr(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted corner and edge-sharing OCr4 trigonal pyramids. Cl(1) is bonded in an L-shaped geometry to two equivalent Cr(1) atoms.
